Details: Both outputs provide comprehensive analysis of Azure Synapse populate_dimensions stored procedure conversion to Fabric code. Ascendion_AAVA provides more detailed complexity scoring (35/100) while Ascendion_AAVA_v2 provides lower complexity assessment (25/100). Both identify key conversion challenges including MERGE statement syntax, orchestration needs, and optimization opportunities. Ascendion_AAVA emphasizes enterprise data warehousing context more strongly, while Ascendion_AAVA_v2 focuses more on practical implementation details.

Both outputs address identical core objective of analyzing populate_dimensions procedure for Fabric conversion. Key semantic alignments: (1) Both identify three dimension tables as targets, (2) Both recognize MERGE operations as primary conversion challenge, (3) Both recommend refactor over rebuild approach. Minor divergences: Ascendion_AAVA emphasizes regulatory reporting context (lines 8-10), while Ascendion_AAVA_v2 focuses on data integration objectives (lines 12-15). Complexity scoring differs significantly (35 vs 25) indicating different assessment methodologies.

Both follow 6-section structure: Overview, Complexity Metrics, Syntax Differences, Manual Adjustments, Optimization, API Cost. Structural differences: (1) Ascendion_AAVA uses markdown headers (**), Ascendion_AAVA_v2 uses numbered sections (#), (2) Complexity metrics table formatting differs - Ascendion_AAVA uses simple table, Ascendion_AAVA_v2 uses detailed description column, (3) Ascendion_AAVA groups high-complexity areas separately (lines 35-40), Ascendion_AAVA_v2 integrates within metrics table. Section ordering and logical flow remain consistent between outputs.
